intro: Hieracium caesitiifolium, commonly known as the sky-blue hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are broadly ovate to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are small, blue to purple, and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, attracting various pollinators. It prefers moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
